fido.files¶

Functions for working with files in python

fido.files.append(path, data)[source]¶

Append data to a text file.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file data (str): File text
Returns:
int: Number of characters appended
fido.files.appendb(path, data)[source]¶

Write data to a binary file.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file data (str): File bytes
Returns:
int: Number of bytes appended
fido.files.delete(path)[source]¶

Delete a file.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file
Returns:
bool: True if the file was deleted, False if not (with message logged)
fido.files.exists(path)[source]¶

Determine if a file exists.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file
Returns:
bool: True if the file exists, False if not
fido.files.mkdirs(filename)[source]¶

Ensures the set of directories exist for the supplied filename.

Args:
filename (str): Full path to where the file should exist
Returns:
Full file path if the directories were created or None
fido.files.read(path)[source]¶

Read a text file.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file
Returns:
str: File text
fido.files.readb(path)[source]¶

Read a binary file.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file
Returns:
File bytes
fido.files.readlines(path)[source]¶

Read lines from a text file.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file
Returns:
list: File text
fido.files.readlinesb(path)[source]¶

Read lines from a binary file.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file
Returns:
list: File bytes
fido.files.subprocess_cmd(command)[source]¶
fido.files.write(path, data)[source]¶

Write data to a text file.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file data (str): File text
Returns:
int: Number of characters written
fido.files.writeb(path, data)[source]¶

Write data to a binary file.

Args:
path (str): Full path to file data (str): File bytes
Returns:
int: Number of bytes written
